page.title: 20THE S.W.R.I. AT HOWNAM
page.content: There is a small but active branch of the S.W.R.I.in the area.Hownam W.R.I. was orriginally founded in 1929.In 1934 another was founded at Towford, farther up the Kale valley,but with the outbreak of war all rural activities ceased,till in 1954 some enthusiastic ladies formed a fresh institute combining the 2 orriginal branches under the name of Towford, meetings alternating between Hownam and Towford.For more that a decade all the meetings have been at Hownam, and membership varies according to population,at present standing at 20. Members meet 10 times in the year,with the sylabus including cookary and hand crafts demonstrations,travel talks etc A festive dinner is held in December, and summer outings to places of local interest.Members compete at institute and federation level regularly.
